Major Airports in the UK

The UK has over 40 airports handling commercial flights, but the major ones are the busiest international hubs, primarily around London and key regional cities. Based on passenger traffic, here are the top 10 busiest airports (as of 2023-2024 data):

Rank Airport Name IATA Code Location Approx. Annual Passengers (millions)
1 London Heathrow LHR London 79
2 London Gatwick LGW London (South) 40
3 Manchester MAN Manchester 28
4 London Stansted STN London (North-East) 28
5 London Luton LTN London (North) 16
6 Edinburgh EDI Edinburgh 15
7 Birmingham International BHX Birmingham 13
8 Bristol BRS Bristol 10
9 Glasgow GLA Glasgow 7
10 Liverpool John Lennon LPL Liverpool 6

These airports serve as key gateways for international travel, with Heathrow being Europe’s busiest and a major global hub. Other notable ones include London City (LCY) for business flights and regional airports like Newcastle (NCL) and Leeds Bradford (LBA).
